message_2:
To factor the given polynomial expression, we will use the factoring by grouping method.

12x^2 + 9xy + 2y^2

First, we will group the terms:

(12x^2 + 9xy) + (2y^2)

Now, we will factor out the greatest common factor (GCF) from each group:

3x(4x + 3y) + y(2y)

Now, we can see that both terms have a common factor of (4x + 3y). We will factor this out:

(4x + 3y)(3x + y)

So, the factored form of the given polynomial expression is:

(4x + 3y)(3x + y)
